did.abstract: Henrietta Scherer (1921-1990) was a social worker and at one time a Communist. This collection contains writings, correspondence, notebooks, and meeting minutes.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials found in collections, provenance is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 2010.046.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Henrietta Scherer (1921-1990) was a social worker and at one time a Communist. A graduate of Thomas Jefferson High School, Brooklyn College and the Columbia University School of Social Work, she worked for the Bureau of Child Guidance, later a part of the New York City Board of Education.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Henrietta Scherer Papers; TAM 539; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection of 1940s material contains writings, most related to her social work school assignments; correspondence and notebooks; minutes of Meetings of Case Workers in Day Nurseries; instructional and other materials from the Jewish Welfare Board; Camp Bronx House; Folk dancing materials; Young Mens' and Young Womens' Hebrew Association materials, including HS writings.
